etymology.interpretation: Combines 女 and 子 to depict a woman with her child, an image traditionally associated with goodness and mutual affection. From this scene the sense broadened to “good, fine, well,” and by extension “easy to” before verbs.

examples.chinese: 这本书很好(這本書很好)。
我们吃完就好好休息(我們吃完就好好休息)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen chī wán jiù hǎohāo xiūxi.
examples.english: After we finish eating, we’ll rest well.

examples.chinese: 这个箱子很好搬(這個箱子很好搬)。
examples.english: This box is easy to move.
